Events that occurred on 16 February.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1856 - The wedding of John Benjamin Tolkien and Mary Jane Stow, J.R.R. Tolkien's paternal grandparents.
1903 - Actor Norman Shelley is born.
1906 - Colin Hardie, Inkling, is born.
1972 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Miss Fay Darrington.
1974 - On the advice of Christopher Tolkien, The Tolkien Society appoints J.R.R. Tolkien as Honorary President in perpetuo.
1991 – The second day of the first "Colloquium on the Languages of Middle-earth" at the house of E.L.F. member Bill Welden.
1995 - Tyalië Tyelelliéva issue 4 is published.
2020 - la BnF's exhibition "Tolkien, voyage en Terre du Milieu" closes.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
Farewell to Lothlórien. Galadriel gives the Fellowship gifts on their departure.
They travel south over the Anduin by boat while Gollum in hiding observes and follows them.
